members.name: getCipherSuite
members.comment: Returns the cipher suite in use on the original connection that retrieved the network resource.

return: a string representing the cipher suite

members.name: getLocalCertificateChain
members.comment: Returns the certificate chain that were sent to the server during handshaking of the original connection that retrieved the network resource. Note: This method is useful only when using certificate-based cipher suites.

return: an immutable List of Certificate representing the certificate chain that was sent to the server. If no certificate chain was sent, null will be returned.

members.name: getServerCertificateChain
members.comment: Returns the server's certificate chain, which was established as part of defining the session in the original connection that retrieved the network resource, from cache. Note: This method can be used only when using certificate-based cipher suites; using it with non-certificate-based cipher suites, such as Kerberos, will throw an SSLPeerUnverifiedException.

throws: SSLPeerUnverifiedException - if the peer is not verified.
return: an immutable List of Certificate representing the server's certificate chain.

members.name: getPeerPrincipal
members.comment: Returns the server's principal which was established as part of defining the session during the original connection that retrieved the network resource.

throws: SSLPeerUnverifiedException - if the peer was not verified.
return: the server's principal. Returns an X500Principal of the end-entity certificate for X509-based cipher suites, and KerberosPrincipal for Kerberos cipher suites.

members.name: getLocalPrincipal
members.comment: Returns the principal that was sent to the server during handshaking in the original connection that retrieved the network resource.

return: the principal sent to the server. Returns an X500Principal of the end-entity certificate for X509-based cipher suites, and KerberosPrincipal for Kerberos cipher suites. If no principal was sent, then null is returned.

members.name: getSSLSession
members.comment: Returns an Optional containing the SSLSession in use on the original connection that retrieved the network resource. Returns an empty Optional if the underlying implementation does not support this method.

implSpec: For compatibility, the default implementation of this method returns an empty Optional. Subclasses should override this method with an appropriate implementation since an application may need to access additional parameters associated with the SSL session.
return: an Optional containing the SSLSession in use on the original connection

name: java.net.SecureCacheResponse
comment: Represents a cache response originally retrieved through secure means, such as TLS.
